body.p: CG Distributor Node is used for distributing CDR files to a local or remote directory. The directory is created automatically if it does not already exist when a file is distributed to that location.

CG Distributor Node first distributes the file with a temporary suffix, so it can be distinguished from completely distributed files. The temporary suffix points to the corresponding batch in the database.

Once the file has been fully stored in the target location, CG Distributor Node verifies that the batch is still in the database. If the batch has been removed from the database, it means that it must have been distributed by some other Output stream in the meantime. In that case, the distributor removes the distributed file with the temporary suffix from the target location. If, on the other hand, the batch is still in the database when the output file has been fully sent to the target location, the distributor removes the temporary suffix from the sent file, marking it as fully distributed, removes the batch and its output records from the database and releases the batch processing lock.
